# MKMultiPoint

**Class**

An abstract class that defines the common behavior that open and closed polygon overlays share.

## Declaration

```swift
class MKMultiPoint
```

## Overview

Don’t create instances of this class directly. Instead, create instances of the [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKPolygon] or [doc://com.apple.mapkit/documentation/MapKit/MKPolyline] classes. However, you can use the methods and property of this class to access information about the specific points associated with the line or polygon.

## Accessing the points in the shape

- **points()**: Returns an array of map points associated with the shape.
- **pointCount**: The number of points associated with the shape.
- **location(atPointIndex:)**: Translates a point index into a unit distance along the shape.
- **locations(at:)**: Translates a point index set into a unit distance along the shape.

## Getting coordinate values

- **getCoordinates(_:range:)**: Retrieves one or more points associated with the shape and converts them to coordinate values.

## Shared behavior

- **MKOverlay**: An interface for associating content with a specific map region.
- **MKOverlayRenderer**: The shared infrastructure for drawing overlays on the map surface.
- **MKShape**: An abstract class that defines the basic properties for all shape-based overlay objects.
- **MKPlacemark**: A user-friendly description of a location on the map.

## Inherits From

- MKShape

## Inherited By

- MKPolygon
- MKPolyline

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- Copyable
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- MKAnnotation
- MKGeoJSONObject
- NSObjectProtocol
